item.Description: Name of alarm. Each alarm has a unique name.
The current alarm severity. An AlarmSeverity enum.
A detailed description of what is wrong. For example if a voltage is out of range, please specify the measured voltage and the range.
The maximum severity seen for this alarm. Reset to `AlarmSeverity_None` if alarm is aknowledged while the `severity` is `AlarmSeverity_None`. An AlarmSeverity enum.
Has this alarm been acknowledged? true=yes, false=no. Irrelevant if `severity` and `maxSeverity` are both `AlarmSeverity_None`.
User who acknowledged the alarm. Irrelevant if `acknowledged` is false.
Blank if escalation not attempted. The ID of the OpsGenie alert, if successfully escalated. "Failed: (...reason...)" if escalation was attempted and failed.

Designated responders, should this alarm be escalated, as a json-encoded list of dicts, each with two keys: "name" and "type". That list is the form OpsGenie uses for the "responders" field of alerts. Json-enconded empty list (e.g. "[]") if this alarm will never be escalated.
Severity at which this alarm is muted. A value of `AlarmSeverity_None` means not muted. If `severity â‰¤ mutedSeverity` then the alarm is considered muted and should not be displayed by default.
User who muted the alarm. Irrelevant if `mutedSeverity` is `AlarmSeverity_None`.
Time at which severity was originally set to its current value.
Time at which severity was most recently found to still have its current value.
Time at which maxSeverity was last changed.
Time at which acknowledged was last changed.

Time at which the alarm will be automatically acknowledged if still stale (not active and not acknowledged). 0 if not relevant in this state or the alarm does not support automatic acknowledgement of stale alarms.
Time at which the alarm will be automatically unacknowledged if still active. 0 if not relevant in this state or the alarm does not support automatic unacknowledgement.
Time at which the alarm was or will be escalated to backup personnel (if `escalated` is true or false, respectively). 0 if not relevant in this state or the alarm does not support escalation.
Time at which the alarm will be unmuted. Irrelevant if `mutedSeverity = AlarmSeverity_None`.
